clinical_study.brief_title: Band Versus Ring for Tricuspid Regurgitation
clinical_study.official_title: Flexible Band Versus Rigid Ring Annuloplasty for the Correction of Tricuspid

brief_summary.textblock: Tricuspid regurgitation is common in patients with heart valve disease, both flexible band and rigid ring annuloplasty can correct this anomaly. However, there is no data to address which one can bring more benefits to these patients with combined heart valve disease. This study aims to prospectively compare the efficacy and long term outcomes of flexible band versus rigid ring annuloplasty for the correction of tricuspid regurgitation.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in severity of tricuspid regurgitation
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in tricuspid regurgitation: refers to Mild or No tricuspid regurgitation Tricuspid regurgitation is graded as mild, moderate, and severe based on regurgitant jet area

secondary_outcome.description: Mortality: Mortality within hospital stay or 1 month postoperative.

arm_group.description: Patients in Group Ring will undergo tricuspid rigid ring annuloplasty
Patients in Group Band will undergo flexible band annuloplasty

intervention.description: Patients will undergo repair of tricuspid regurgitation
